intro: Didymocarpus rottlerianus var. lanuginosus, commonly known as the hairy rottleria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color, followed by oval, woody fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant in tropical regions.
